Docs.summary: Provides access to state pertinent to all HTTP modules relevant to federated authentication in the web application.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can access the modules that are configured for the web application through the static properties exposed by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthentication> class. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthentication.GetHttpModule%2A> method provides an extension point through which other application-defined modules that derive from <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.HttpModuleBase> and that are configured for the application can be accessed.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthentication.FederationConfiguration%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property references a singleton instance of <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> that provides configuration settings for the HTTP modules. The first time the property is accessed by one of the HTTP modules, a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> instance is initialized from the [<federationConfiguration>](/dotnet/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/federationconfiguration) element in the configuration file and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthentication.FederationConfigurationCreated> is raised to provide an application with the opportunity to modify the configuration object before it is used to initialize module properties. The same <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> instance is returned on each subsequent access of the property.
> [!IMPORTANT] > The claims authorization manager (<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsAuthorizationManager>) that is used to evaluate claims based access checks when using the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.ClaimsPrincipalPermission> class or the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.ClaimsPrincipalPermissionAttribute> class is configured on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration> object that is set on the federation configuration object referenced through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthentication.FederationConfiguration%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property. This is true for all applications whether they are ASP.NET applications or not.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> object is created and initialized from the [<federationConfiguration>](/dotnet/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/federationconfiguration) element in the configuration file the first time this property is accessed by one of the HTTP modules. Just after the configuration object has been initialized, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthentication.FederationConfigurationCreated> event is raised to provide a developer with an opportunity to modify the newly created configuration object before it is used to initialize any of the configured HTTP modules. It can be accessed from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfigurationCreatedEventArgs.FederationConfiguration%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property in an event handler.
On subsequent accesses, the same configuration instance is returned.
Depending on whether specific modules are present, the property is accessed from within the following methods during initialization: <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.ClaimsAuthorizationModule.InitializePropertiesFromConfiguration%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionAuthenticationModule.InitializePropertiesFromConfiguration%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationAuthenticationModule.InitializePropertiesFromConfiguration%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
> [!IMPORTANT] > The claims authorization manager (<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsAuthorizationManager>) that is used to evaluate claims based access checks when using the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.ClaimsPrincipalPermission> class or the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.ClaimsPrincipalPermissionAttribute> class is configured on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration> object that is set on the federation configuration object referenced through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthentication.FederationConfiguration%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property. This is true for all applications whether they are ASP.NET applications or not.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthentication.FederationConfigurationCreated> event is raised when the first HTTP module in the web application references <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthentication.FederationConfiguration%2A> property. The first access of the this property causes a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> object to be created and initialized from the [<federationConfiguration>](/dotnet/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/windows-identity-foundation/federationconfiguration) element in the configuration file. You can access the newly created <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> object through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfigurationCreatedEventArgs.FederationConfiguration%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property in an event handler in order to examine or modify it before it is used to provide initialization for any of the HTTP modules configured for the application.
